data.title: Les Oberlé by Bazin, René: very good Hardcover (1925)
data.meta_description: Hardcover - Calmann-Lévy, Paris - 1925 - Condition: very good - Story concerning the Germanization of Alsace-Lorraine, depicting the conflicts of divided loyalty within the Oberlé family. Influential traditionalist with telegant style, love of nature and a respected member of the spiritual family of French Catholic writers that includes, among others, Maurice Barrès, Georges Bernanos, and François Mauriac. Text in French. Bound in half leather with marble paper-covered boards, marbled endpapers, gilt lettering to the spine. The binding is tight and firm with the boards and all internal pages securely attached. There is some wear to the extremities includingsome bumping to the corners. Internally the pages are generally clean with age darkening. - Les Oberlé
